trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Citrix ShareFile | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Citrix ShareFile | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Citrix ShareFile with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Citrix ShareFile with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Citrix ShareFile.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Citrix ShareFile.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Citrix ShareFile tenant
trans-unit.target: A Citrix ShareFile tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Citrix ShareFile will be able to single sign into the application at your Citrix ShareFile company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Citrix ShareFile will be able to single sign into the application at your Citrix ShareFile company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Citrix ShareFile
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Citrix ShareFile

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Citrix ShareFile.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Citrix ShareFile.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Citrix ShareFile.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Citrix ShareFile.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Citrix ShareFile, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Citrix ShareFile, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Citrix ShareFile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Citrix ShareFile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Citrix ShareFile with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Citrix ShareFile with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Citrix ShareFile application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Citrix ShareFile application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Citrix ShareFile page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Citrix ShareFile page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Citrix ShareFile Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern https://.shareFile.com, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Citrix ShareFile Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern https://.shareFile.com, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Citrix ShareFile page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Citrix ShareFile page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ConfigureSingle Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ConfigureSingle Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Citrix ShareFile company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Citrix ShareFile company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Admin.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Admin.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, select Configure Single Sign-On.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, select Configure Single Sign-On.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Account Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Account Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign-On/ SAML 2.0 Configuration dialog page under Basic Settings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign-On/ SAML 2.0 Configuration dialog page under Basic Settings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Enable SAML.
trans-unit.target: Click Enable SAML.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Citrix ShareFile dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the Your IDP Issuer/ Entity ID textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Citrix ShareFile dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the Your IDP Issuer/ Entity ID textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Citrix ShareFile dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Citrix ShareFile dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Citrix ShareFile dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Citrix ShareFile dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Change next to the X.509 Certificate field and then upload the certificate you downloaded from the Azure AD portal.
trans-unit.target: Click Change next to the X.509 Certificate field and then upload the certificate you downloaded from the Azure AD portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Basic Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Basic Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Save on the Citrix ShareFile management portal.
trans-unit.target: Click Save on the Citrix ShareFile management portal.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Citrix ShareFile, they must be provisioned into Citrix ShareFile.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Citrix ShareFile, they must be provisioned into Citrix ShareFile.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Citrix ShareFile, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Citrix ShareFile, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Citrix ShareFile tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Citrix ShareFile tenant.

trans-unit.source: Click Manage Users \> Manage Users Home \> + Create Employee.
trans-unit.target: Click Manage Users \> Manage Users Home \> + Create Employee.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create Employee</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create Employee</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the Email, First name and Last name of a valid Azure AD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Email, First name and Last name of a valid Azure AD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Basic Information</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Basic Information</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add User.
trans-unit.target: Click Add User.

trans-unit.source: The AAD account holder will receive an email and follow a link to confirm their account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The AAD account holder will receive an email and follow a link to confirm their account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Citrix ShareFile user account creation tools or APIs provided by Citrix ShareFile to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Citrix ShareFile user account creation tools or APIs provided by Citrix ShareFile to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Citrix ShareFile **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Citrix ShareFile **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
